Redshift Managed Storage (RMS) does not use S3 Tables; RMS has its own managed storage

aws-redshift-rms:cdc-support:v2.notes: Redshift Managed Storage (RMS) does not use S3 Tables; RMS has its own managed storage

aws-redshift-rms:cdc-support:v3.notes: Redshift Managed Storage (RMS) does not use S3 Tables; RMS has its own managed storage

aws-redshift-rms:lineage:v2.notes: Redshift Managed Storage (RMS) does not use S3 Tables; RMS has its own managed storage

aws-redshift-rms:lineage:v3.notes: Redshift Managed Storage (RMS) does not use S3 Tables; RMS has its own managed storage

aws-firehose:position-deletes:v2.notes: Firehose is a delivery service; it writes to Iceberg tables but does not read or process delete files

aws-firehose:position-deletes:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Firehose does not support delete operations

aws-firehose:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Firehose will use equality deletes for updates and deletes

aws-firehose:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Firehose append-only mode effectively uses copy-on-write semantics (new data files, no delete files)
caveats: Only append mode; no UPDATE/DELETE support

aws-firehose:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Firehose can deliver to tables with evolved schemas but cannot perform schema changes itself
caveats: Schema changes must be made externally

aws-firehose:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature

aws-firehose:column-default-values:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature

aws-firehose:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Firehose supports writing to hidden-partitioned Iceberg tables using dynamic partitioning

aws-firehose:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature

aws-firehose:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:time-travel:v2.notes: Firehose is a write-only delivery service; no read or query capabilities

aws-firehose:time-travel:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Firehose does not perform table maintenance operations

aws-firehose:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Firehose does not support branching and tagging

aws-firehose:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:read-support:v2.notes: Firehose is a write-only delivery service

aws-firehose:read-support:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:write-insert:v2.notes: Firehose delivers streaming data as INSERT/append operations to Iceberg tables on S3

aws-firehose:write-insert:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: Firehose supports MERGE, UPDATE, and DELETE operations using JSON query definitions to specify the operation type
caveats: Requires JSON query to define the operation
When you specify the operation as update or delete, you must either specify unique keys for the destination table when you set up your Firehose stream, or set identifier-field-ids in Iceberg

aws-firehose:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Firehose integrates with AWS Glue Data Catalog for Iceberg table metadata

aws-firehose:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Firehose uses AWS Glue Catalog exclusively for Iceberg

aws-firehose:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose uses AWS Glue Data Catalog for Iceberg table delivery

aws-firehose:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:rest-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support REST Catalog

aws-firehose:rest-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:nessie:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Nessie catalog

aws-firehose:nessie:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:polaris:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Polaris catalog

aws-firehose:polaris:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Unity Catalog

aws-firehose:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Hadoop catalog

aws-firehose:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support JDBC catalog

aws-firehose:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:table-creation:v2.notes: Firehose cannot create Iceberg tables; the table must already exist

aws-firehose:table-creation:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant Type is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:variant-type:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded Variant is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry Type is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:geometry-type:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector Type is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:vector-type:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:cdc-support:v2.notes: Cdc Support is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:cdc-support:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:lineage:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:statistics:v2.notes: Firehose writes basic column statistics to Iceberg manifest files when delivering data to Iceberg tables. Statistics are written automatically as part of the standard Iceberg write path.
caveats: Limited configuration options for statistics compared to Spark
Firehose is a write-only delivery service

aws-firehose:statistics:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Firehose does not support configuring Parquet-level bloom filters or Puffin-based bloom filter statistics for Iceberg tables.

aws-firehose:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:type-promotion:v2.notes: Firehose is an ingestion service and does not support DDL operations like type promotion. Schema evolution in Firehose is limited to adding new columns from source schema changes.
caveats: Firehose cannot perform ALTER TABLE or type change operations
Type promotions must be performed externally using Athena, Spark, or another DDL-capable engine

aws-firehose:type-promotion:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-managed-flink:position-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via user-provided iceberg-flink-runtime JAR on Amazon Managed Flink (Flink 1.19/1.20 with Iceberg 1.6.0+)
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR in their application

aws-managed-flink:position-deletes:v3.notes: V3 support available when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ (which supports format-version 3). Managed Flink itself is not listed in AWS's V3 support matrix since it runs user-provided JARs
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support
Not listed in AWS V3 support matrix  V3 depends entirely on the Iceberg library version bundled by the user

aws-managed-flink:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via UPSERT mode with equality deletes in the Flink Iceberg connector; requires V2 format and primary key
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Equality deletes supported with V3 format when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Merge-on-read supported via streaming upsert mode using equality deletes in the Flink Iceberg connector
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Merge-on-read supported with V3 format including deletion vectors when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Copy-on-write supported via INSERT INTO and INSERT OVERWRITE in the Flink Iceberg connector
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Copy-on-write supported with V3 format when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Flink can read tables with evolved schemas, but ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties  column additions, renames, drops, reordering, and partition changes are not supported via Flink SQL DDL
caveats: ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties; column and partition schema changes not supported via Flink SQL
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Flink can read V3 tables with evolved schemas, but ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties  column and partition changes not supported via Flink SQL DDL
caveats: ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties; column and partition schema changes not supported via Flink SQL
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:column-default-values:.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature
Column default values are a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 column default values

aws-managed-flink:nanosecond-timestamps:.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature
Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 nanosecond timestamps

aws-managed-flink:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Flink can read and write to tables with hidden partitions created by other engines, but Flink DDL PARTITION BY does not support transform functions (e.g., days(), hours(), bucket())
caveats: Flink DDL PARTITION BY does not support transform functions; use Spark or another engine to create hidden-partitioned tables
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Flink can read and write to V3 tables with hidden partitions created by other engines, but Flink DDL does not support creating tables with transform-based partitioning
caveats: Flink DDL PARTITION BY does not support transform functions; use Spark or another engine to create hidden-partitioned tables
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Partition evolution supported via the Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation)
caveats: Requires Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation)

aws-managed-flink:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Partition evolution supported via the Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation) for V3 tables
caveats: Requires Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation)

aws-managed-flink:multi-arg-transforms:v.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature
Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 multi-argument transforms

aws-managed-flink:time-travel:v2.notes: Flink supports time travel via snapshot-id and as-of-timestamp read options in batch mode, plus branch and tag reads via SQL hints
caveats: Uses SQL hint syntax (/*+ OPTIONS('snapshot-id'='...') */) rather than native SQL time travel syntax

aws-managed-flink:time-travel:v3.notes: Time travel supported for V3 tables via snapshot-id, as-of-timestamp, branch, and tag read options when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Uses SQL hint syntax (/*+ OPTIONS('snapshot-id'='...') */) rather than native SQL time travel syntax
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Flink supports the rewrite files action (compaction) but does not support expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, or rewrite_manifests  use Spark for full maintenance
caveats: Only rewrite files action available; expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, rewrite_manifests not supported
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Flink supports the rewrite files action (compaction) for V3 tables but does not support expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, or rewrite_manifests
caveats: Only rewrite files action available; expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, rewrite_manifests not supported
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Flink can write to branches via FlinkSink.toBranch() and read from branches/tags via SQL hints. Cannot create or manage branches/tags via DDL
caveats: Cannot create or manage branches/tags; read and write to existing branches/tags only

aws-managed-flink:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Flink can write to branches and read from branches/tags for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+. Cannot create or manage branches/tags via DDL
caveats: Cannot create or manage branches/tags; read and write to existing branches/tags only
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support in both batch and streaming modes, including incremental reads from snapshots via Flink Iceberg connector
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:read-support:v3.notes: Full read support for V3 tables in both batch and streaming modes when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO supported in both batch and streaming modes; INSERT OVERWRITE supported in batch mode only
caveats: INSERT OVERWRITE is not supported in streaming mode
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:write-insert:v3.notes: INSERT INTO and INSERT OVERWRITE supported with V3 format when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+; INSERT OVERWRITE is batch-only
caveats: INSERT OVERWRITE is not supported in streaming mode
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:write-merge-update-del.notes: Flink supports UPSERT mode via equality deletes (requires V2 format and primary key) but does not support SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE statements
caveats: No SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE syntax; uses streaming upsert mode with equality deletes instead
UPSERT requires V2+ format and a PRIMARY KEY defined on the table

aws-managed-flink:write-merge-update-del.notes: Flink supports UPSERT mode via equality deletes for V3 tables but does not support SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE statements
caveats: No SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE syntax; uses streaming upsert mode with equality deletes instead
UPSERT requires a PRIMARY KEY defined on the table
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Supports built-in Iceberg catalog types (hive, hadoop, rest, glue, jdbc, nessie) plus custom catalog implementations via catalog-impl
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR and iceberg-aws-bundle for AWS integrations

aws-managed-flink:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Supports built-in Iceberg catalog types for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) and iceberg-aws-bundle for AWS integrations

aws-managed-flink:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Hive Metastore supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='hive'; requires bundling Hive connector JARs alongside iceberg-flink-runtime
caveats: Requires bundling Hive connector JARs (e.g., flink-sql-connector-hive) in addition to iceberg-flink-runtime

aws-managed-flink:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Hive Metastore supported for V3 tables via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='hive' when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires bundling Hive connector JARs and iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: AWS Glue Data Catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='glue'; requires bundling iceberg-aws-bundle alongside iceberg-flink-runtime
caveats: Requires bundling iceberg-aws-bundle JAR for Glue and S3 integration

aws-managed-flink:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: AWS Glue Data Catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ and iceberg-aws-bundle
caveats: Requires bundling iceberg-aws-bundle JAR for Glue and S3 integration
Requires iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:rest-catalog:v2.notes: REST Catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='rest'
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:rest-catalog:v3.notes: REST Catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:nessie:v2.notes: Nessie supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='nessie'
caveats: Requires Nessie endpoint configuration and bundling iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:nessie:v3.notes: Nessie supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires Nessie endpoint configuration and iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:polaris:v2.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog API (catalog-type='rest') with Polaris endpoint
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Polaris

aws-managed-flink:polaris:v3.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog API for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Polaris
Requires iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API (catalog-type='rest') but not a natural fit for the AWS ecosystem
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Unity Catalog
Not a typical integration for AWS Managed Flink

aws-managed-flink:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API for V3 tables but not a natural fit for the AWS ecosystem
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Unity Catalog
Not a typical integration for AWS Managed Flink

aws-managed-flink:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Hadoop catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='hadoop'; ships with Hadoop jars by default in iceberg-flink-runtime

aws-managed-flink:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Hadoop catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: JDBC catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='jdbc'; requires bundling JDBC driver JAR
caveats: Requires bundling JDBC driver JAR and endpoint configuration

aws-managed-flink:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: JDBC catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ and JDBC driver
caveats: Requires bundling JDBC driver JAR and iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:table-creation:v2.notes: Flink Iceberg connector supports CREATE TABLE via Flink SQL DDL; partitioning limited to identity transforms only
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR
PARTITION BY does not support transform functions (days, hours, bucket, truncate)

aws-managed-flink:table-creation:v3.notes: V3 table creation supported via Flink SQL DDL with 'format-version'='3' table property when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support
PARTITION BY does not support transform functions (days, hours, bucket, truncate)

aws-managed-flink:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:variant-type:v3.notes: Variant type is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support for the variant type
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 variant type

aws-managed-flink:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded variant is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Shredded variant is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 shredded variant

aws-managed-flink:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:geometry-type:v3.notes: Geometry type is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 geometry type

aws-managed-flink:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:vector-type:v3.notes: Vector type is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 vector type

aws-managed-flink:cdc-support:v2.notes: Flink Iceberg connector supports CDC via UPSERT mode with equality deletes on V2 tables; requires primary key and write.upsert.enabled=true
caveats: Requires V2 format and PRIMARY KEY defined on the table
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:cdc-support:v3.notes: CDC via UPSERT mode supported on V3 tables with deletion vectors when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires PRIMARY KEY defined on the table
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:lineage:v2.notes: Row lineage is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:lineage:v3.notes: Row lineage is a V3 feature introduced with deletion vectors; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support for querying row lineage metadata fields
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 row lineage metadata fields (_row_id, _last_updated_sequence_number)

aws-managed-flink:statistics:v2.notes: Flink Iceberg connector writes column statistics to manifest files by default via the standard Iceberg write path. Uses statistics for scan planning during reads.
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:statistics:v3.notes: Column statistics supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Bloom filter support requires further testing to confirm
caveats: Needs further testing to confirm support

aws-managed-flink:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Bloom filter support requires further testing to confirm
caveats: Needs further testing to confirm support

aws-managed-flink:type-promotion:v2.notes: Flink supports type widening for Iceberg tables

aws-managed-flink:type-promotion:v3.notes: Flink supports type widening for Iceberg V3 tables
